name: Scotch Whisky
description: Traditional whisky made in Scotland using malted barley.

name: Bourbon Whiskey
description: American whiskey primarily made from corn and aged in charred oak barrels.

name: Irish Whiskey
description: Whiskey produced in Ireland with a smooth and light flavor profile.

name: Rye Whiskey
description: Whiskey made primarily from rye grain, known for its spiciness.

name: Canadian Whisky
description: Whisky made in Canada, typically lighter and smoother in style.

name: Japanese Whisky
description: Whisky produced in Japan, often influenced by Scotch whisky production methods.

name: Single Malt Whisky
description: Whisky made from malted barley at a single distillery.

name: Blended Whisky
description: Whisky made by blending malt whisky and grain whisky.

name: Tennessee Whiskey
description: Whiskey produced in Tennessee, similar to Bourbon with additional charcoal filtering.

name: Corn Whiskey
description: Whiskey made primarily from corn, offering a distinct flavor profile.

name: Wheat Whiskey
description: Whiskey made from a majority of wheat, known for its soft and smooth character.

name: American Single Malt Whiskey
description: Single malt whiskey produced in the United States, resembling Scotch whisky.

name: Straight Whiskey
description: Whiskey aged for a specific period, meeting certain legal requirements.

name: Peated Whisky
description: Whisky with a distinctive smoky flavor resulting from the use of peat during malting.

name: Cask Strength Whisky
description: Whisky bottled at its original cask strength, without dilution.
